page.title: 02FARMING IN BARROW-ON-TRENT
page.content: THERE ARE TWO MAIN FARMS IN BARROW(THE GRANGE ,FIRTREE)THE MAIN TYPE OF FARMING IN BOTH OF THESE FARMS IS DAIRY FARMING.IN FIRTREE THERE ARE 6 CALVES, ONE BULL, ONE SHEEPDOG,ONE PONEY AND, THIRTY COWS.BOTH OF THESE FARMS BELONG TO THE ATKINS FAMILY.THE MACHIMARY THAT BELONGS TO FIRTREE IS ONE COMBINE HARVESTER,THREE TRACTORS, TWO MILKING MACHINES,ONE GRASSCHOPPER,ONE BAILER.THE CROPS THAT FIRTREE GROW ARE BARLEY,WHEAT,OATS ,GRASS AND RAPE, THE ANIMALS CONSIST OF 10 PIGS,450 COWS,50 BEEF CATTLE AND 150 DAIRY COWS ALONG WITH 700 ACRES OF LAND ON BOTH OF THE FARMS PUT TOGETHER. IN THE GRANGE THEY HAVE THE SAME TYPE OF MACHINERY.BOTH OF THE FARM HOUSES WERE BUILT IN THE 1700s.
